title: Compost Athens GA | Enrich Your Soil Naturally
description: Nourish your garden with Soul Miners Eden’s premium compost. Improve soil health, boost plant growth, and create a thriving landscape with our natural compost.
content:
Compost Athens GA | Enrich Your Soil Naturally
What is Composting?
Composting is a natural process that transforms organic materials, such as food scraps, yard trimmings and other organic waste, into a nutrient-rich soil amendment. This process is driven by microorganisms and insects that break down the organic materials into a humus-like substance. By composting, we can significantly reduce food waste, promote sustainability and mitigate greenhouse gas emissions.
Composting can be done in various settings, from backyard composting to community gardens and large-scale composting facilities. The composting process involves mixing food scraps, leaves and grass clippings with soil, water and air. This mixture is then left to decompose, with regular turning and monitoring to ensure optimal conditions.
Types of Compost
All of our compost is made on-site with strict controls to ensure consistency and quality. We never use biosolids, and our compost meets Organic Standards and Certified Naturally Grown criteria, providing you with a safe and sustainable product for your soil.
Food Scrap Compost
Food scrap compost is made from organic kitchen waste, such as fruit and vegetable peels, coffee grounds, eggshells, bread and other biodegradable food items. Rich in nitrogen, food scrap compost is ideal for garden beds, vegetable plots and flower beds.
Green Waste Compost
Green waste compost is composed of yard and landscaping debris, including grass clippings, leaves, branches, hedge trimmings and other plant-based materials. With its ability to improve soil structure, green waste compost is ideal for landscaping and lawn care.
Premium Organic Compost Production
Our compost is carefully crafted to meet the highest quality standards. Using a precise mix of organic materials, we create a nutrient-rich product designed to improve soil health and plant growth. Throughout the composting process, we conduct rigorous testing to ensure consistency, proper nutrient levels and a balanced pH.
We believe in transparency—feel free to request test results to see exactly what goes into our compost. At Soul Miner’s Eden, we understand that healthy soil is the foundation of successful landscaping and gardening, and we’re committed to delivering the best.
Our Composting Process
Transforming organic waste into nutrient-rich compost is both an art and a science. Here’s how we do it:
Locally Sourced Materials
We start with green waste from the Athens area, including hardwoods, pine trees and vegetation, which is ground multiple times to create a fine base.
Perfect Ratios
Our process incorporates wood ash, bio char and various nitrogen sources to balance carbon and nitrogen levels.
Precision and Care
We turn the compost regularly, monitor temperatures with probes to maintain optimal microbial activity, and ensure proper aeration and moisture.
Enhanced Quality
Bi-monthly applications of Omega from Southland Organics further enrich the compost with beneficial microbes, resulting in a high-quality, nutrient-dense product.
Compost Soil Health Benefits
Improves Soil Structure
Compost enhances aeration and drainage while increasing the soil’s ability to retain moisture.
Boosts Fertility
Organic compost slowly releases nutrients, providing a balanced diet for your plants throughout the growing season.
Supports Plant Health
Rich in beneficial microorganisms, compost strengthens plants’ natural defenses against pests and diseases.
Improves Moisture Retention
Compost helps soil retain water, reducing the need for frequent watering.
Compost Choices
Soul Miner’s 
Humus Compost
$45 / yard
Material: Crafted on-site from green waste and food scraps under strict quality controls. Free of biosolids and meets Organic Standards and Certified Naturally Grown criteria
Color: Rich, dark brown with a fine, crumbly texture
Available Quantities: Sold by the cubic yard. Measured by the yard, perfect for large agricultural or landscaping projects.
CompostNow 
Vegetative Compost
$80 / yard
Material: Made from 100% plant-based food scraps and yard waste
Color: Rich, dark brown with a fine, crumbly texture
Available Quantities: Sold by the cubic yard. Measured by the yard, ideal for large-scale projects
Easy Order Premium Topsoil
Enter Your Address
Start typing your address, and our system will match it automatically.
Select Your Product
Choose from our high-quality mulch, topsoil, or compost options.
Enter Quantity
Input the total number of yards you need.
Once completed, a quote will pop up showing the product cost and delivery fee. If you’re satisfied, you can enter your name and credit card details to confirm your order. We’ll schedule your delivery and ensure your materials arrive on time!
Compost for Every Project
About Our Composting Facility
At our composting facility in Athens, Georgia, we operate under a Permit by Rule as defined by Georgia law. This designation allows us to manage food waste and other organic materials responsibly and efficiently while adhering to state regulations. For more information on the Permit by Rule requirements, visit the Georgia Environmental Protection Division website.
Our facility is located on agriculturally zoned land in Athens-Clarke County and is designed to support sustainable composting operations that benefit our local community. We specialize in community composting, transforming tea bags, food scraps, and yard waste into nutrient-rich compost.
Composting Operations and Equipment
Our advanced composting operations utilize: 
‍Tractors and Wheel Loaders: For material movement and pile management
‍Humic Acid and Microbe Sprayers: To accelerate decomposition and enrich the final product
‍Custom Processes: To ensure consistent quality and adherence to the standards set by the Composting Council of the United States
Commitment to Sustainability
We’re proud to serve Athens-Clarke County and beyond by promoting responsible waste management and supporting a circular economy. Our facility is part of a growing movement in community composting across the United States, demonstrating how local solutions can make a global impact. Whether you’re a farmer, landscaper or gardener, our compost products are designed to enrich your soil and enhance plant health while keeping organic waste out of landfills.
Terms to Know:
‍Food Scraps: Organic materials like fruit and vegetable peels, bread and grains that can be composted
‍Organic Materials: Materials like food scraps, yard trimmings and other organic waste that can be composted
‍Composting Process: The natural process of breaking down organic materials into a nutrient-rich soil amendment
‍Food Scrap Collection: The collection of food scraps for composting
‍Greenhouse Gas Emissions: Emissions that contribute to climate change, which can be reduced through composting
‍Wasted Food: Composting is an effective way to minimize food waste.
‍Compost Hauler: A company or individual that collects and composts organic materials
‍Absorb Odors: Composting helps absorb odors and reduce pests.
‍Soil Health: Composting improves soil health and supports plant growth.
Committed to Your Success
With the right landscaping supplies, tools, and materials, you can create a stunning outdoor space that lasts. At Soul Miner’s Eden, we are here to help homeowners, businesses, and landscapers get the best selection of landscaping products at the best prices.

title: Double Ground Hardwood Mulch | Enhance Your Landscaping
description: Enhance your landscape with double ground hardwood mulch. Ideal for moisture retention, weed control, and aesthetics. Available for pickup or delivery.
content:
Double Ground Hardwood Mulch | Enhance Your Landscaping
Key Benefits of Double-Ground Mulch
Enhanced Aesthetic
Provides a polished, professional look for garden beds and pathways through the finer texture and uniform appearance
Temperature Regulation
Insulates plant roots, keeping them cool in summer and warm in winter
Weed Control
Creates a barrier that minimizes weed growth, reducing competition for nutrients and water
Moisture Retention
Helps soil retain water, reducing the need for frequent watering
Natural Decomposition
Breaks down gradually, enriching the soil with organic matter over time
Ease of Application
Spreads easily compared to coarser mulches
Ideal Uses for Double-Ground Mulch
Flower Beds and Garden Borders: Provides a clean, finished look while protecting plants
‍Pathways and Walkways: Creates an inviting and functional surface for foot traffic
‍Shrubs and Tree Rings: Adds a protective layer around plant bases while improving aesthetics
‍Residential and Commercial Landscaping: Suitable for projects of all sizes, delivering a professional appearance
How to Choose the Right Mulch for Your Yard
Material
Hardwood mulch, such as double-ground hardwood, is renowned for its durability and moisture retention properties. Other options include pine mulch, cypress mulch and recycled mulch, each offering unique benefits.
Texture
The texture of the mulch affects its application and appearance. Double-ground mulch has a finer texture, making it easier to spread and apply evenly across the ground. In contrast, single-ground mulch has a coarser texture.
Color
Mulch color can significantly impact the aesthetic of a landscape. Double-ground mulch often comes in rich brown tones, and other mulches may offer different color options to match a garden’s design.
Budget
Determine your budget for mulch. Double-ground mulch is competitively priced, making it a cost-effective option for covering large areas without compromising on quality.
Delivery
Think about how you’ll get your mulch. Our delivery service is ideal for handling large quantities, with a dump truck capable of delivering up to 18 cubic yards of mulch directly to your location. Each cubic yard provides approximately 27 cubic feet of material.
Application
Think about how you will apply the mulch to your yard. Double-ground mulch is easy to spread and apply, making it an excellent choice for covering large areas efficiently.
How to Use Double-Ground Mulch
Prepare the Area
Clear weeds, grass and debris from the area where the mulch will be applied.
Apply the Mulch
Spread an even 2–3 inch layer of mulch around plants, shrubs and trees, ensuring it doesn’t touch the plant stems.
Refresh Annually
Replenish your mulch each year to maintain its effectiveness and appearance.
Committed to Your Success

title: Pine Bark Mulch | Eco-Friendly Mulch for Landscaping & Gardens
description: Pine Bark Mulch from Soul Miner’s Eden—eco-friendly, durable, and perfect for gardens and landscaping. Available for delivery or pickup. Order today!
content:
Pine Bark Mulch | Eco-Friendly Mulch for Landscaping & Gardens
What is Pine Bark Mulch?
Pine bark mulch is a type of organic mulch made from the shredded bark of pine trees. This natural mulch is an excellent way to enhance soil quality, suppress weeds and retain moisture in gardens. Available in various forms and textures, pine bark mulch can be finely shredded, double processed or processed in larger chunks known as pine nuggets. The choice of texture depends on personal preference and the specific needs of a garden. Whether you opt for a finer consistency or larger pieces, pine bark mulch provides a versatile and effective solution for maintaining a healthy and beautiful garden.
Improves Soil Health
Enriches the soil with organic matter as it decomposes, improving its structure and fertility
Temperature Control
Insulates roots, keeping them cool in summer and warm in winter
Weed Suppression
Creates a natural barrier to minimize weed growth and reduce competition for nutrients
Improves Drainage
Reduces the risk of waterlogged soil and root rot
Water Retention
Helps the soil retain moisture, reducing the need for frequent watering
Natural Beauty
Provides a clean, rustic appearance that complements any garden or landscape
Ideal Uses for Pine Bark Mulch
Planting: Provides a healthy base for growth for flower beds, shrubs and trees
Soil Amendment: Improves soil drainage and aeration, allowing plant roots to access water and oxygen more effectively, making it an excellent addition for plants that prefer acidic soil.
Decorative Mulch: Perfect for pathways, garden borders and landscaping projects, offering long-lasting beauty.
How Pine Bark Affects Soil pH
As pine tree bark mulch decomposes, it releases organic compounds that slightly lower the soil’s pH over time. This is especially beneficial in areas with alkaline or neutral soil, as it creates a more acidic environment ideal for plants that prefer lower pH levels, such as:
Azaleas
Rhododendrons
Hydrangeas
Blueberries
Camellias
The gradual acidification of the soil helps plants absorb essential nutrients like iron, phosphorus and magnesium more efficiently, leading to healthier, more vibrant growth.
Benefits of Adjusting Soil pH with Pine Bark
‍Enhanced Nutrient Availability: Optimal pH allows plants to take up essential nutrients more effectively.‍
Eco-Friendly Gardening: Pine bark mulch supports a balanced ecosystem in the garden while enriching the soil with organic matter.‍
Improved Plant Health: Acid-loving plants grow stronger and more vibrant in soil conditions suited to their needs.‍
Natural and Sustainable: Pine bark mulch offers a chemical-free way to influence soil pH over time.
How to Use Pine Bark Mulch for pH Benefits
Test the Soil: Use a soil test kit to determine the soil’s pH level.
Apply Pine Bark Mulch: Spread a 2–3 inch layer around plants that prefer acidic soil, keeping it a few inches away from plant stems.
Monitor and Maintain: Replenish the mulch annually to sustain its positive effects on pH and soil health.
Tips for Applying Pine Bark Mulch
Mulch Layering: Apply a 2–3 inch layer of pine bark mulch around plants, ensuring it is kept a few inches away from the base of the plant to prevent rot and other problems.
Even Distribution: Use a rake or trowel to spread the mulch evenly, preventing matting and ensuring consistent coverage
Replenishment: Replenish the mulch as needed, typically every 6–12 months, to maintain its effectiveness and appearance.
Avoid Over-Mulching: Be careful not to apply mulch too close to plant stems or trunks, as this can cause rot and other issues.
Weed Barriers: Consider using a landscape fabric or weed barrier under the mulch to further prevent weeds from growing up through the mulch.
How to Choose the Right Mulch for Your Yard
Material
Hardwood mulch, such as double ground hardwood, is renowned for its durability and moisture retention properties. Other options include pine mulch, cypress mulch and recycled mulch, each offering unique benefits.
Texture
The texture of the mulch affects its application and appearance. Double ground mulch has a finer texture, making it easier to spread and apply evenly across the ground. In contrast, single ground mulch has a coarser texture.
Color
Mulch color can significantly impact the aesthetic of a landscape. Double ground mulch often comes in rich brown tones, and other mulches may offer different color options to match a garden’s design.
Budget
Determine your budget for mulch. Double ground mulch is competitively priced, making it a cost-effective option for covering large areas without compromising on quality.
Delivery
Think about how you’ll get your mulch. Our delivery service is ideal for handling large quantities, with a dump truck capable of delivering up to 18 cubic yards of mulch directly to your location. Each cubic yard provides approximately 27 cubic feet of material.
Application
Think about how you will apply the mulch to your yard. Double ground mulch is easy to spread and apply, making it an excellent choice for covering large areas efficiently.
How to Use Pine Bark Mulch
Prepare the Area
Clear weeds, grass, and debris from the area where the mulch will be applied.
Apply the Mulch
Spread an even 2–3 inch layer of black mulch around plants, shrubs, and trees, ensuring it doesn’t touch the plant stems.
Refresh Annually
Replenish your mulch each year to maintain its effectiveness and appearance.
Committed to Your Success

title: Bioretention Soil for Sustainable Stormwater Management
description: Discover high-quality bioretention soil from Soul Miner’s Eden. Ideal for rain gardens, bioswales, and retention basins, our soil supports stormwater management and plant health.
content:
Bioretention Soil for Sustainable Stormwater Management
What is Bioretention Soil?
Bioretention soil is a custom mix of sand, organic matter and soil designed to filter stormwater, promote infiltration and support plant life. It’s commonly used in green infrastructure projects such as:
‍
Rain Gardens: Filtering and absorbing stormwater runoff
Bioswales: Slowing and cleaning stormwater while directing it to specific areas
Retention Basins: Capturing and filtering stormwater in engineered areas
Definition of Bioretention
Bioretention is a sophisticated stormwater management system that leverages the natural filtration capabilities of soil, plants and microbes to treat stormwater runoff. Essentially, it involves creating a shallow, landscaped depression designed to capture and filter stormwater runoff, significantly reducing the amount of pollutants that enter our waterways. These systems are particularly effective in urban areas, where impervious surfaces like parking lots, roads and buildings prevent natural water infiltration. By incorporating bioretention systems, we can manage stormwater runoff more efficiently, promoting cleaner water and healthier urban environments.
Key Benefits of Bioretention Soil
Effective Stormwater Management: Filters pollutants and reduces runoff, improving water quality
Improves Drainage: Promotes water infiltration to prevent pooling and erosion
Supports Plant Health: Provides the nutrients plants need to thrive in bioretention systems
Eco-Friendly: Helps create sustainable, low-impact developments that protect the environment
Custom Engineered: Meets the specific requirements of your project, balancing sand, silt and organic matter for optimal performance
Economic Benefits of Bioretention Soils
Bioretention systems offer a range of economic benefits that make them an attractive option for both public and private projects:
Reduced Stormwater Management Costs: By decreasing the reliance on traditional stormwater infrastructure such as pipes and ponds, bioretention systems can lead to significant cost savings in both installation and maintenance.
Increased Property Values: The aesthetic appeal of bioretention systems can enhance the overall value of a property, making it more appealing to potential buyers or renters.
Job Creation: The construction and ongoing maintenance of bioretention systems create job opportunities in various sectors, including landscaping, construction and environmental management.
Reduced Flood Damage: By effectively managing stormwater runoff, bioretention systems help mitigate the risk of flooding, thereby protecting property and infrastructure from potential damage.
Applications for Bioretention Soil
Rain Gardens
Perfect for residential or commercial gardens designed to capture and filter runoff
Green Infrastructure
Ideal for use in bioswales, retention basins and other engineered stormwater solutions
Landscaping Projects
Provides a sustainable soil solution for areas prone to waterlogging or erosion
Engineered Soil for Bioretention
Engineered soil is a cornerstone of effective bioretention systems. This specially designed soil mix is tailored to meet the unique requirements of bioretention applications, ensuring optimal performance in stormwater management. Engineered soils are crafted to support healthy plant growth while efficiently filtering stormwater runoff, making them indispensable in creating sustainable and functional bioretention systems.
Design and Construction
The design and construction of bioretention systems are pivotal in capturing and filtering stormwater runoff efficiently. Each bioretention system is tailored to the specific needs of the site and the goals of the project. The process involves:
Site Assessment: Evaluating the site to understand the volume and flow of stormwater runoff, as well as the characteristics of the surrounding environment.
Design: Creating a detailed plan that includes the layout, depth and plant selection for the bioretention area. The design must ensure proper grading to direct stormwater flow into the system.
Construction: Excavating the area and installing the bioretention soil mix to the required depth. Ensuring even distribution of the soil and proper layering is crucial for the system’s effectiveness.
Planting: Selecting and planting native or water-tolerant species that complement the soil’s filtration properties and enhance the system’s aesthetic appeal.
By following these steps, bioretention systems can be effectively integrated into urban landscapes, providing a sustainable solution for managing stormwater runoff and improving water quality.
Committed to Your Success

title: Buy Affordable Single Ground Mulch | Durable Landscaping Solution
description: Discover Single Ground Mulch at Soul Miners Eden—durable, cost-effective, and perfect for gardens, pathways, and large landscaping projects. Order now for delivery!
content:
Buy Affordable Single Ground Mulch
Key Benefits of Single-Ground Mulch
Erosion Control
Helps hold soil in place with its coarse texture, making it ideal for sloped areas and landscapes prone to erosion
Durability
Provides long-lasting ground coverage with larger wood pieces breaking down more slowly
Weed Suppression
Creates a natural barrier to minimize weed growth and reduce competition for nutrients
Moisture Retention
Reduces water evaporation, helping soil stay moist for longer
Soil Enrichment
Adds organic matter to soil as it decomposes, improving soil structure and fertility
Cost-Effective
Ideal for large-scale projects where durability and affordability are key
Ideal Uses for Single-Ground Mulch
Commercial Landscaping: Provides cost-effective coverage for larger areas like parks, schools and public spaces
‍Erosion Control: Stabilizes slopes, embankments or areas with loose soil
‍Trail and Pathway Covering: Creates a natural, rustic look for trails and walkways
‍Tree and Shrub Beds: Provides durable ground coverage around larger plants
How to Choose the Right Mulch for Your Yard
Material
Hardwood mulch is renowned for its durability and moisture retention properties. Other options include pine mulch, cypress mulch and recycled mulch, each offering unique benefits.
Texture
The texture of the mulch affects its application and appearance. Single-ground mulch has a coarser texture, and double-ground mulch has a finer texture.
Color
Mulch color can significantly impact the aesthetic of a landscape. Some mulches comes in rich brown tones, and other mulches may offer different color options to match a garden’s design.
Budget
Determine your budget for mulch. Single-ground mulch is competitively priced, making it a cost-effective option for covering large areas without compromising on quality.
Delivery
Think about how you’ll get your mulch. Our delivery service is ideal for handling large quantities, with a dump truck capable of delivering up to 18 cubic yards of mulch directly to your location. Each cubic yard provides approximately 27 cubic feet of material.
Application
Think about how you will apply the mulch to your yard. With its coarse texture, single-ground mulch is durable and provides efficient coverage and long-lasting results.
How to Use Single-Ground Mulch
Prepare the Area
Clear weeds, grass and debris from the area where the mulch will be applied.
Apply the Mulch
Spread an even 2–3 inch layer of mulch around plants, shrubs and trees, ensuring it doesn’t touch the plant stems.
Refresh Annually
Replenish your mulch each year to maintain its effectiveness and appearance.

title: Sod Soil for Lush Lawns | Buy Premium Soil from Soul Miner’s Eden
description: Create a vibrant lawn with Soul Miner’s Eden’s premium sod soil. Designed for sod installation and lawn repair, it offers optimal drainage and nutrients.
content:
Sod Soil for Lush Lawns
Key Benefits of Sod Soil
Nutrient-Rich
Packed with essential nutrients to feed new sod, ensuring it takes root effectively and grows strong, especially during the initial weeks after installation
Loamy Texture
Provides a firm yet breathable foundation for sod roots to establish quickly through a balanced mix of sand, silt and clay
Optimal Drainage
Ensures water flows properly, preventing pooling or waterlogged areas that can harm sod
Weed-Free Base
Helps prevent weed growth, giving sod the best chance to grow without competition
Ideal Uses for Our Specialty Sod Soil
Sod Installation: Provides the ideal base for laying new sod, ensuring roots take hold effectively to establish a healthy new lawn
Lawn Repair: Ideal for patching damaged areas or leveling uneven spots before adding sod
Landscaping Projects: Great for creating smooth, uniform surfaces in residential or commercial landscaping
How to Use Sod Soil
Prepare the Area
Remove existing grass, debris and weeds. Level the area to create a smooth, even surface. For small areas, consider using hand tools for rough grading to address drainage issues or a hand-powered spreader for overseeding, especially in shaded spots.
Apply Sod Soil
Spread a 1–2 inch layer of sod soil evenly across the area.
Install Sod and Water
Lay sod directly on top of the soil, ensuring each piece is tightly placed. Water immediately after installation to encourage root establishment. 
Preparing the Site for Sod
Before laying new sod, start by removing any existing grass and roots, as these can compete with new sod for nutrients and water. Next, rake the area to remove any remaining debris and to level the surface. This preparation will help new sod take root more effectively and create a smooth, even lawn.
Soil Preparation
The soil should be tilled to a depth of at least two inches to loosen and aerate it. This process helps to control weeds, alleviate subsoil compaction and permit bonding of the topsoil to the subsoil. Additionally, tilling improves root penetration, air exchange and water movement, giving new sod the best chance to take root. After tilling, it’s beneficial to mix in organic matter, such as compost, to further enrich the soil. This will provide essential nutrients that support healthy root growth and overall lawn vitality.
Soil Testing and pH Adjustment
Most grass types prefer a slightly acidic soil pH, ranging from 6.0 to 7.0. If soil pH is too high or too low, it can affect the growth and health of new sod. To test soil pH, bring a sample to your local garden center or county Cooperative Extension office. Based on the results, you may need to adjust the pH level by adding lime or sulfur. For example, if soil pH is too low, adding lime can help raise it, while adding sulfur can help lower it if it’s too high. By determining the pH level and adjusting it accordingly, you can create an optimal environment for new sod to thrive.
